alert.note: Alert for Central and Eastern Lake County; Klamath Basin; Northern and Eastern Klamath County and Western Lake County (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 06 at 5:50PM PST until January 06 at 10:00PM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM PST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 3 to 5 inches. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...Portions of Modoc County in California and Lake and Klamath counties in Oregon. This includes the eastern foothills of the Cascades, the Warner Mountains, the higher terrain of the Fremont Winema National Forest. This also includes Keno, Chiloquin, Chemult, Lakeview, Davis Creek, much of Highway 97, Highway 140 at Quartz Mountain summit, and portions of Highway 395. * WHEN...From 4 AM to 10 PM PST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions and low visibilities due to snow and blowing snow. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. * Carry tire chains and be prepared for snow covered roads and limited visibilities. * See https://www.tripcheck.com or http://quickmap.dot.ca.gov for latest road conditions. * A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means that periods of snow will cause travel difficulties.

area.areaDesc: Central and Eastern Lake County; Klamath Basin; Northern and Eastern Klamath County and Western Lake County
